title: American_Top_40_1983_May_7th, 1983
description:
"Once a week with AT40 and you know how your favorite songs are doing all over the USA, like the first American hit by the English band, Def Leppard. They climb four notches to fifteen with, "Photograph."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

One listener asks, "So far in the 80's, what act has had the most top 40 hits?" This act has had 12.

One act in the countdown just recently erected a billboard that read, "Majority for Musical Morality. Together we can stop the heavy metal poising of America."

Bryan Adams, Def Leppard, and Dexy's Midnight Runners have their first songs to hit the American chart.

There a seven acts that have two songs in the countdown.

One performer in the countdown was once caught as a stow-away on an ocean liner.

Casey answers what he says is one of the toughest questions AT40 has ever been asked; "Who is the youngest person ever heard (not the youngest singer) in a top 40 hit?"
